revised_title: An Unusual Bony Growth in the Thorax
tldr: A surgeon, Mr. William Giffard, discovers a bony substance in the thorax of a patient who died from peripneumonia. The growth was found to be closely connected to the ribs and inner intercostal muscles, and was covered by a thick membrane. The patient had experienced symptoms such as cough, difficulty breathing, and pain on the right side before succumbing to the disease.
